page.title: 19FISHING IN THE RIVER TEES
page.content: The River Tees here is well-stocked with{Brown Trout}and Grayling.All of the fishing is private or leased to clubs,but visitor's permits are available.Approved methods of fishing are with{artificial fly}or natural bait such as minnow or worm.Spinning or maggot fishing are not allowed.For this fast-flowing river wet-fly up or, more usually,downstream is the most sporting method.Flies are lightly hackled.Some of the favourites are: Snipe & Purple,Greenwell's Glory,March Brown,Partridge & Orange & Gold-ribbed Hare's Ear.Reduced{pollution}in the tidal reaches in recent years has brought back,after many year's absence,migratory fish to a river famous for its Salmon run since pre-Norman times.
